rule: The output must not be formatted as HTML.
input: The wind blows. The rain falls. The snow glistens.
output:
The wind winds its way through the city streets in a dance of gentle caress and fierce blow, as if it were a mistress that was simply not quite all there and the rain pours down with a quiet force each and every drop. Just when we look up at the sky to see the clouds start to build, the snow falls, falling against our fingers with a subtle yet unmistakable power, just like a mother calling her child in the distance as she stands holding your hand.

While it is all very peaceful and serene, there are times that we feel the cold sting of fear, a chill that runs through every inch of our body when we look out at the snow, and just when we think nothing will cross our minds or change the weather, the wind hits us from behind, driving rain down onto us with no mercy and no pity...

But it is not like this, so we are not afraid. We cannot be. The rain might seem to pour against us, but on the inside of our bodies there is a warm liquid, gentle as cotton candy and yet, utterly satisfying, filling up all our sweat-streaked muscles with its warmth without making us feel too stiff by doing it.
